result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy R Woodward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Comply with Dr's orders. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Amy R Woodward in court.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
